lexUnit.name: full.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: containing or holding as much or as many as possible; having no empty space.

sentence.text: But my mouth was already full of bread and meat .
If your cupboards are full to bursting , put up a handy shelf .
Mrs. Jordan came down in midafternoon with a basket full of hot spiced rolls and honey , all wrapped in white linen ; behind her came Mrs. Jarrett with cups and two cans of steaming chocolate .
Perhaps you have shelves full of books all over the house .
A drawer full of medicines , mostly old with faded and encrusted writing .
She turned away to get something out of the fridge , which turned out to be a glass bowl full of trifle .
It is a pretty nineteenth-century house full of strange alcoves and columns , in Kolon√°ki , the smart residential quarter .
Her eyes had a greenish tinge and her full mouth was compressed with fury .
One particular bedroom is so spacious it can accommodate up to four people and full of atmosphere , with an unusual brick vaulted ceiling .
We stayed in a dormitory that was full of couples with noisy small children , and it put quite a strain on our marriage .
The room had seating capacity for about eighty and Mark saw that it was about half full .
Of course very soon his pub was full of war - mad wankers talking about sport .
The motorwagons were full of smiling , unreadable pilgrims in black , presumably joyous at being so close to their destination , Salt Lake City .
By late Friday evening , the campsite was already half full with more campers arriving by the minute .
Bedrooms are modern but full of rustic style and charm with their pine panelling and wonderful mountain views .
The place was too full of memories ; like the day she 'd discovered most kids had mothers , not just a Bran .

WHEN he was having his treatment , Roy told me through a mouth full of ulcers that he dreamed of having a Madras curry .
He produced a full bottle of whisky from his briefcase , poured out three tumblerfuls , and asked if he could have the television on .
Jack-in-a-Box packs are full of dolly mixtures and farmyard animal gums .
